title: How to Import an Image Into Photoshop

steps.title: Open Photoshop on your PC or Mac.
steps.content: Open Photoshop on your PC or Mac. It’s in the All Apps area of the Start menu in Windows, and the Applications folder in macOS. Use this method if you want to import a single image into your Photoshop project.

steps.title: Open the file you want to work on.
steps.content: Open the file you want to work on. To do this, click the File menu, select Open , then double-click the file. To create a new file, press Ctrl + N (Windows) or ⌘ Cmd + N (Mac), name the file, then click OK .

steps.title: Click the New Layer icon.
steps.content: Click the New Layer icon. It’s near the bottom-right corner of the Layers panel. It looks like a square sheet of paper with an upturned corner. This creates a new layer.

steps.title: Click the File menu.
steps.content: Click the File menu. It’s at the top-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Click Place….
steps.content: Click Place… . It’s near the center of the menu. This opens your computer’s file browser. This may be called Place Embedded in some versions of Photoshop.

steps.title: Select the image you want to import and click Place.
steps.content: Select the image you want to import and click Place .

steps.title: Click the checkmark.
steps.content: Click the checkmark. It’s at the top of the screen. The image is now placed on the new layer.

steps.title: Open Adobe Photoshop Mix.
steps.content: Open Adobe Photoshop Mix. This app icon looks like two circles overlapping. You can find this on the home screen, in the app drawer, or by searching. If you don’t have Adobe Photoshop Mix, you can get it for free from either the Google Play Store (Android) or the App store (iOS). The Photoshop Express app only supports editing one image at a time, and you can do so by tapping Open from the File menu. However, Photoshop Mix requires you to have a subscription for the Adobe Suite to use. You can use the app with a 7-day free trial.

steps.title: Sign up or sign in if prompted.
steps.content: Sign up or sign in if prompted.

steps.title: Tap the blue circle with a plus (+) icon.
steps.content: Tap the blue circle with a plus (+) icon. You’ll find this in the lower right corner of your screen. This is the button to create a new project.

steps.title: Tap Device.
steps.content: Tap Device . If you have images already saved to your phone, this will take you to your local images folder. You can tap the other choices for other storage locations.

steps.title: Tap an image.
steps.content: Tap an image. You can edit that image further using all the tools above and below the image.

steps.title: Tap the small white circle with the plus (+) icon.
steps.content: Tap the small white circle with the plus (+) icon. You’ll see this to the right of your image. Tapping this will prompt you to open another image.

steps.title: Tap Device.
steps.content: Tap Device . If you have images already saved to your phone, this will take you to your local images folder. If you have images saved in the other locations, tap through to find them.

steps.title: Tap an image.
steps.content: Tap an image. The second image is on another layer within Mix. You may need to resize the canvas. You can edit that image further using all the tools above and below the image.

steps.title: Tap the images to switch between images and layers.
steps.content: Tap the images to switch between images and layers.

steps.title: Tap the Share icon .
steps.content: Tap the Share icon . You’ll see this in the upper right corner of the app.

steps.title: Tap Save To Gallery to save a copy of your creation.
steps.content: Tap Save To Gallery to save a copy of your creation. You can also share with compatible apps within the ••• option.
